Element.Name: p_fld_ref
Element.Description: This is a unique reference number used for traceability purposes between this document and other documents.

Element.Name: p_fld_parent_ref
Element.Description: Reference to a higher level requirement number being addressed. For a Functional Requirement it would be the related User Requirement reference numbers and for a Design Requirement would be the related Functional Requirement reference numbers. User requirements may reference regulatory requirements and technical standards.

Element.Name: p_fld_note
Element.Description: Any notes, such as version number for changes.

Element.Name: p_fld_ref
Element.Description: This is a unique reference number used for traceability purposes between this document and other documents.

Element.Name: p_fld_ref
Element.Description: This is a unique reference number used for traceability purposes between this document and other documents.

Element.Name: p_fld_ref
Element.Description: This is a unique reference number used for traceability purposes between this document and other documents.

Element.Name: p_fld_parent_ref
Element.Description: Reference to a higher level requirement number being addressed. For a Functional Requirement it would be the related User Requirement reference numbers and for a Design Requirement would be the related Functional Requirement reference numbers. User requirements may reference regulatory requirements and technical standards.

Element.Name: p_fld_parent_ref
Element.Description: Reference to a higher level requirement number being addressed. For a Functional Requirement it would be the related User Requirement reference numbers and for a Design Requirement would be the related Functional Requirement reference numbers. User requirements may reference regulatory requirements and technical standards.

Element.Name: p_fld_req
Element.Value: The application shall basically manage a user's “to do” items in a list. List items are received from a server application which is outside the scope of this document.

Element.Name: p_fld_req
Element.Value: Items shall be received from a server as RSA encrypted JSON object files.

Element.Name: p_fld_req
Element.Value: The application shall decrypt received JSON object files and display certain information from them.

Element.Name: p_fld_req
Element.Value: The application shall send information to the server as files of various types.

Element.Name: p_fld_req
Element.Value: The application shall RSA encrypt files prior to sending them to the server.

Element.Name: p_fld_req
Element.Value: The mock-ups in this section are taken from the following Gnome 3 extension:,https:github.comkaergnome-shell-extension-modern-calc,The code in the extension may be re-used providing references are made and the GNU licence terms are honoured.,The basic application shall look like the below mock-up image, referred to as the “Normal View”.

Element.Name: p_fld_req
Element.Value: The application shall require secure log in by the desktop user.

Element.Name: p_fld_req
Element.Value: User authentication shall be provided by a server request. Server configuration is outside the scope of this document.

Element.Name: p_fld_req
Element.Value: Once logged in, the application shall “remember” the user's username and password and automatically sign in on next start up.

Element.Name: p_fld_req
Element.Value: The window may slide in and out from the left or right side of the screen based on mouse cursor proximity or use of a hot-key combination as defined in the application preferences.

Element.Name: p_fld_req
Element.Value: The window may be minimised or maximised by clicking a tray icon.

Element.Name: p_fld_req
Element.Value: The application shall automatically adjust to the height of the user's screen.

Element.Name: p_fld_req
Element.Value: The application shall be set to a fixed width as defined in the preferences.

Element.Name: p_fld_req
Element.Value: The application window will have the following sections highlighted in yellow:

Element.Name: p_fld_note
Element.Value: Click to authenticate the user with the server and login to provide readwrite access to all data allocated to the user's group. User group configuration is server side and outside the scope of this application. ,The login dialog shall display as an overlay on the application window.

Element.Name: p_fld_note
Element.Value: Click to display the Preferences dialog with applicable options and settings. ,The preferences dialog shall display as an overlay on the application window.

Element.Name: p_fld_note
Element.Value: Tabs are used to select between different content. In the MVP only one tab is required.

Element.Name: p_fld_note
Element.Value: Click to show the history of completed list items. ,The history dialog shall display as an overlay on the application window.

Element.Name: p_fld_note
Element.Value: Click to re-arrange the list of of items. Sort by Priority, Due Date, Received Date. Filter by Priority, Status. The available fields are described later in this document.

Element.Name: p_fld_note
Element.Value: This shows a list of 5 items. Each item will have a title, an image and a colour. Hovering over the item will show a tool tip with more information. ,Clicking on an item will invoke a command as defined by the item's JSON data. A typical command would be an OS shell command to invoke another application. For example, in MS Windows, the command "C:\Program Files\Microsoft Office\Office14\winword" q x l"x:\pb.dotm" "x:\anybot.json"

Element.Name: p_fld_note
Element.Value: This shall indicate how many more items are in the list but not displayed on the main window. ,Clicking on the Pending box shall display an alternative view of all current list items as an overlay on the application window..

Element.Name: p_fld_note
Element.Value: This shall be reserved for animations, breaking news, advertisements, etc. For example, new items will appear to come down the turning spiral and when the user completes an item they will drag and drop an object (such as a document from a word processor) onto this region which shall animate and show the object disappearing up the turning spiral. In the future other functionality may be delivered here, such as chat sessions.

Element.Name: p_fld_req
Element.Value: “Material Design” concepts shall generally be used throughout, but colour shall be used only sparingly to capture the attention of the user. Thus, the application shall generally be greyscale, with the following specific colours sparingly applied:

Element.Name: p_fld_req
Element.Value: Users shall be required to register with a server in order to use the application. The server shall store user credentials, group membership and group privileges information in a MongDB document database. The database and server side programming is outside the scope of the application.

Element.Name: p_fld_req
Element.Value: Configurable preferences shall be displayed using modern controls such as onoff sliders, date pickers, etc.

Element.Name: p_fld_note
Element.Value: OS shell command to invoke the system word processor

Element.Name: p_fld_note
Element.Value: OS shell command to invoke the system spreadsheet editor

Element.Name: p_fld_req
Element.Value: A back navigation arrow will return the user to the main application window.

Element.Name: p_fld_req
Element.Value: The search function shall search through all known items for matching information. The search shall be more in-depth than the keyword based Filter and Sort function described below and will provide the functionality to sort through all JSON object content, including any target objects (such as documents or spreadsheets), not just on selected keywords as per the Filter and Sort function.

Element.Name: p_fld_req
Element.Value: Whilst considered a “future” requirement, tabs need to be engineered into the application from the very beginning rather than added later.

Element.Name: p_fld_req
Element.Value: Future tabs might be for a calculator, unit converter or other collaboration views not yet thought of. The number of tabs eventually required is unknown at this time, therefore left and right arrows may be required in the tab heading list if the width of headings exceeds the space available.

Element.Name: p_fld_req
Element.Value: The history display shall present a list of completed list items.

Element.Name: p_fld_req
Element.Value: The information presented in the history display will come as a JSON object in response to a server request for history items completed by the user.

Element.Name: p_fld_req
Element.Value: A back navigation arrow will return the user to the main application window.

Element.Name: p_fld_req
Element.Value: By default, the top 5 priority current items shall be displayed.

Element.Name: p_fld_req
Element.Value: Clicking on the Pending button will change the display to an entire List View so as many list items as possible can be seen.

Element.Name: p_fld_req
Element.Value: A vertical scrollbar shall be displayed if the number of items exceeds the window height.

Element.Name: p_fld_req
Element.Value: A back navigation arrow will return the user to the main application window.

Element.Name: p_fld_req
Element.Value: This region will act as a container for other content or applications.

Element.Name: p_fld_req
Element.Value: The region will support drag and drop functionality by sending the information of what was dropped onto it into the container content provider or receiving the information of what was dragged out of the container content provider.

Element.Name: p_fld_req
Element.Value: The application shall be written in a suitable programming language and framework which will allow the same codebase to run on the following operating systems:

Element.Name: p_fld_req
Element.Value: The application shall be written in a suitable programming language and framework which will allow the same codebase to run as a desktop app or as a web app.

Element.Name: p_fld_req
Element.Value: The software shall make use of as much existing open source project code as possible to minimise time and cost.

Element.Name: p_fld_req
Element.Value: The software shall be open source with an appropriate licence and shall respect the licence of any existing code.

Element.Name: p_fld_req
Element.Value: Authentication shall use open source methods, such as OAuth 2.0.

Element.Name: p_fld_req
Element.Value: Encryption shall use open source methods, such as gpg.

Element.Name: p_fld_req
Element.Value: All objects in the system architecture will be very loosely coupled with only RSA encrypted JSON messages used for inter-process communication.

Element.Name: p_fld_req
Element.Value: A notional architecture is provided below to set the context for the application:

Element.Name: p_fld_req
Element.Value: An example list item JSON file is provided below:
